channel.title: Cloud, DevOps, Databases & AI with Michael
channel.description: Recent content on Cloud, DevOps, Databases & AI with Michael

item.title: AI Updates
item.description: AI main updates 19th June 2024 Claude 3.5 Sonnet was released. If you compare it with other LLM models, it does fairly well: (Reference: https://www.anthropic.com/news/claude-3-5-sonnet) 13th May 2024 Check out new GPT-4o model, lot cheaper and better compared to some of previous GPT models Written By Michael Agarwal

item.title: Azure Updates
item.description: Azure main updates for month of May Azure Virtual Network Manager’s virtual network verifier feature is now in public preview, enabling you to check if your network policies allow or disallow traffic between your Azure network resources. Azure Load Balancer now supports health event logs to help you identify and troubleshoot ongoing issues affecting your load balancer resource’s health. VM hibernation for general-purpose VMs is now generally available in all public regions.

item.title: AWS Updates
item.description: AWS main updates week of 06/17/2024 FOCUS is a new open-source cloud billing data specification that provides standardization to simplify cloud financial management across multiple sources. Data Exports for FOCUS 1.0 includes several AWS-specific columns, such as usage types and cost categories, and delivers exports on a daily basis to Amazon S3 as Parquet or CSV files. Anthropic’s Claude 3.5 Sonnet foundation model is now generally available in Amazon Bedrock. That was fast :-)

item.title: Rich Content Via Hugo
item.description: Hugo ships with several Built-in Shortcodes for rich content, along with a Privacy Config and a set of Simple Shortcodes that enable static and no-JS versions of various social media embeds. YouTube privacy enhanced shortcode The youtube shortcode embeds a responsive video player for YouTube videos. Only the ID of the video is required, e.g.: YouTube URL: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=3qHkcs3kG44 Shortcode: {{< youtube 3qHkcs3kG44 >}} Rendered output: Headings To create a heading, add number signs (#) in front of a word or phrase.
